news_header: U.S. mortgage applications declined by 1.3% for the week ending September 27, 2024, with a modest increase in mortgage rates.
news_text: According to the Mortgage Bankers Association's Weekly Applications Survey, U.S. mortgage applications fell by 1.3% for the week ending September 27, 2024. The Market Composite Index decreased by 1.3% on a seasonally adjusted basis, while the Refinance Index dropped by 3%, although it remains 186% higher than last year. Conversely, the seasonally adjusted Purchase Index rose by 1%, indicating more homebuyers entering the market. Mike Fratantoni, MBA's Chief Economist, noted that despite rising mortgage rates, which increased to 6.14%, economic growth continues. Refinance applications accounted for 54.9% of total applications, with FHA applications rising and VA applications declining. Interest rates for various mortgage types also saw slight increases.
